Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2017 08:00AM Henrietta405 wrote: Hi Karina, I’m relatively new to BC and Stage 4, but I wanted to reply. I also felt badly before I was diagnosed — shortness of breath, night sweats, fatigue, no appetite. I had pulmonary embolisms and tumors in my lungs and liver. I started to feel better after my first chemo treatment. It helps me to remember that the treatments are killing all those cancer cells that were making me feel crappy. I hope your symptoms start to improve quickly
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed Stage 4 need some help please Karina Karina

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2017 02:14PM Henrietta405 wrote: I have liver mets and am on Taxol with herceptin and perjeta. My tumors have also decreased dramatically after just 3 treatments. I did have elevated liver enzyme numbers before treatment.
Posts.Title: Liver Mets and Taxol (success stories?) PDXson PDXson

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2017 12:48PM Henrietta405 wrote: I also get bad bone pain with the Taxol. I’ve found it’s best if I consistently take Tylenol the day after chemo until the days I get my worst side effects, then I switch to Percocet. Keeping pretty warm also helps— I sleep with a hot water bottle or heating pad at night. My MO also recommended hot baths
